title.narrative: 3.2 CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT AND ASSESSMENT

description.narrative: 3.2 The Government has improved capacity to design and implement competency-based curricula and assessment at the preschool and basic education levels., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Digital Transformation, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, more children, especially the most vulnerable benefit from inclusive and equitable early childhood education (ECE), quality basic education and improved learning outcomes.

related-activity.ref: 4630/A0/06/883 3. EDUCATION AND EARLY LEARNING AND DEVELOPMENT

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 3.2 The Government has improved capacity to design and implement competency-based curricula and assessment at the preschool andbasic education levels.

description.narrative: Over a million;1-2;grades;schoolchildren;are;benefiting;from the;newly introduced;gender and disability-sensitive;textbooks;and support materials;and;government experts are;now able to;design;and implementing;competency-based, gender-responsive and inclusive curricula and assessment at preschool and basic education;levels.;;More than 1000 courses are now available in local languages;to complement;learning materials and enable alternative pedagogic pathways in the country.;2,187 young people have accessed these; courses;since;their;introduction in November 2021. Alternative early childhood education;models;focusing on innovative pedagogy applied in two regions and enabled;366 children from;vulnerable backgrounds;to;access;preschool education.;; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:14/01/2022
